trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Kontiki | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Kontiki | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Kontiki with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Kontiki with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Kontiki.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Kontiki.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Kontiki single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Kontiki single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Kontiki will be able to single sign into the application at your Kontiki company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Kontiki will be able to single sign into the application at your Kontiki company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Kontiki
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Kontiki

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Kontiki.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Kontiki.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Kontiki.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Kontiki.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Kontiki, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Kontiki, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Kontiki</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Kontiki</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Kontiki with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Kontiki with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Kontiki application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Kontiki application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Kontiki page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Kontiki page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Kontiki Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to Kontiki (e.g.: “https://company.mc.eval.kontiki.com/"), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Kontiki Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to Kontiki (e.g.: “https://company.mc.eval.kontiki.com/"), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Kontiki page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Kontiki page, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata file on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Send the metadatafile to the Kontiki support team.
trans-unit.target: Send the metadatafile to the Kontiki support team.

trans-unit.source: The single sign-on configuration has to be performed by the Kontiki support team.
trans-unit.target: The single sign-on configuration has to be performed by the Kontiki support team.

trans-unit.source: You will get a notification as soon as the configuration has been completed.
trans-unit.target: You will get a notification as soon as the configuration has been completed.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single SignOn</linkText>

trans-unit.source: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Kontiki.
trans-unit.target: There is no action item for you to configure user provisioning to Kontiki.

trans-unit.source: When an assigned user tries to log into Kontiki using the access panel, Kontiki checks whether the user exists.
trans-unit.target: When an assigned user tries to log into Kontiki using the access panel, Kontiki checks whether the user exists.

trans-unit.source: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Kontiki.
trans-unit.target: If there is no user account available yet, it is automatically created by Kontiki.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Kontiki **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Kontiki **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
